posts._title: Frank Borzage & George B. Seitz – Big City (1937)
posts.title: Big City
posts.excerpt: Plot:Celebrate the short career (10 Hollywood films and two Oscars®*) and long life (100 years young in 2010 and an honored participant in the TCM Classic Film Festival) of one of the screen’s nonpareil stars with this threesome of the fourth, fifth and sixth films Luise Rainer made in Tinseltown. The Viennese beauty portrays a …

posts.title: Sobibor, 14 octobre 1943, 16 heures
posts.excerpt: The Sobibor uprising in 1943 in Poland was investigated by Mr. Lanzmann many years ago when he was filming “Shoah” and his interviews with a participant named Lerner date from then. The director felt that the Sobibor uprising, which led to the closure of the extermination camp by the Nazis after many escaped, was too …

posts.title: 63 Up
posts.excerpt: Director Michael Apted revisits the same group of British-born adults after a 7 year wait. The subjects are interviewed as to the changes that have occurred in their lives during the last seven years.

posts._title: Takashi Miike – Bijitâ Q AKA Visitor Q (2001)
posts.title: Bijitâ Q
posts.excerpt: Synopsis;A troubled and perverted family find their lives intruded by a mysterious stranger who seems to help find a balance in their disturbing natures. A father, who is a failed former television reporter tries to mount a documentary about violence and sex among youths. He proceeds to have sex with his daughter who is now …

posts.title: Elis
posts.excerpt: The life of Elis Regina, undoubtedly the greatest Brazilian singer of all time, is told in this biopic film with energetic and pulsating rhythm.

posts._title: Jean Girault – La soupe aux choux AKA The Cabbage Soup (1981)
posts.title: La soupe aux choux
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:One evening, two old French farmers, Le Glaude (Louis de Funès) and Cicisse (Jean Carmet), start a farting contest which seems to provoke a lighting storm. What actually happens is that they send a signal to aliens and one (Jacques Villeret) arrives to change their lives.

posts._title: Daniel Gordon – The Game of Their Lives (2002)
posts.title: The Game of Their Lives
posts.excerpt: This is a great documentary about the North Korean soccer team that staged a series of improbable upsets as they advanced through the 1966 World Cup. More than just a sports documentary, it’s a fascinating look at the hermetic nation of North Korea, as well as 1960’s England fascination with their little known or understood …

posts.title: El Ángel (2018)
posts.excerpt: Quote:Carlitos is a seventeen-year-old youth with movie star swagger, blond curls and a baby face. As a young boy, he coveted other people’s things, but it wasn’t until his early adolescence that his true calling–to be a thief–manifested itself. When he meets Ramon at his new school, Carlitos is immediately drawn to him and starts …

posts.title: Gentry
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:‘Gentry stars Roger Daltrey in a blackly comic suspense drama in which a couple buy a shabby house in an up-and-coming area but find themselves drawn into the aftermath of an armed robbery.’– Network

posts.title: Quelque chose d’organique
